item.title: Report X-2023030834
item.description:
Report X-2023030834

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-02
  • City: NAMPA
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UTLX 211632 was found releasing by the FRA in the UPRR Nampa yard. Graymar Environmental responded, found one swing bolt less than tool tight resulting in approximately 1/2 gallon released. Graymar replaced the nozzle gasket, secured the manway swing bolts, and decontaminated the car.

item.title: Report X-2023030633
item.description:
Report X-2023030633

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-06
  • City: POCATELLO
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package either shifted during transit or had a crack to one of the bottles containing the hazmat liquid after it was loaded onto the P&D van for delivery. DescribePack: Package contained 4 gallons of the Hydrochloric acid Solution. This package either shifted during transit or had an unknow crack to the bottom of one of the gallons causing a leak from the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a plastic bag and on top of some old cardboard in the P&D van. After the package was removed and put into a hazmat container the area as well as the package was coated in the neutralizing powder provided in the station's hazmat cleanup kit.

item.title: Report X-2023030490
item.description:
Report X-2023030490

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-03
  • City: RATHDRUM
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/3/23, the Y SPO1011 03 was working on the east end of Hauser yard. During their work, the crew noticed locomotive diesel fuel leaking out of the bottom of the TCBX 286060, listed as line 18 in track 3509. It was at this time that the crew notified the yardmaster who immediately notified BNSF mechanical and transportation officers on site. BNSF Mechanical promptly contacted the BNSF Hazmat team and began an active investigation into the leak and to apply containment. The BOV was found with an ice plug in the broken BOV cap with damage to the closed BOV. Fuel was recovered into a vacuum truck while a transload of remaining fuel occurred to another car. An estimated 7,768 gallons was released from the car with approximately 6,350 gallons reaching soil. Spilled fuel impacted tracks 3509 and 3510. Investigation into extent of fuel impacts to soil and remediation began immediately. Soil impacts and remediation are being coordinated with ID DEQ.

item.title: Report X-2023030103
item.description:
Report X-2023030103

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-22
  • City: JEROME
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Drum was unloaded from trailer and transported to P&D route. Driver notified QA of spill in truck. QA responded and cleaned up the spill. Drum was transferred to QA for inspection in a black tote to control spill. DescribePack: Drum was cracked on bottom and allowed leakage from container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was put in a black tote to contain the spill and small amount released in truck was cleaned up with proper PPE.

  • City: BOISE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AM QA discovered package leaking in unload. Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent. DescribePack: The container had a loose cap and 2 fl. oz. of the content spilled inside the plastic bag that the container was in and also leaked on the bottom of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent.

DescribePack: No inner packaging, lid loose, and crack found on bottom of bin. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: QA personnel notified immediately and QA put hazmat pkg inside red hazmat bin to contain spill.

item.title: Report E-2023010120
item.description:
Report E-2023010120

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-14
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Passenger Lee was traveling from Seattle to Boise on SkyWest flight 3831. While in flight passengers Lee Flum vape pen began to get warm and create a dangerous evolution of heat. Passenger Lee took the device and unhooked the wiring while in the Lav. Passenger Lee then gave the deice to the Flight Attendant, the device was then placed into a cup of water for the rest of the flight. Nothing notable happened to the device for the remainder of the flight. Once the flight arrived the device was placed into an airport trash can.

  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Outbound QA discovered package leaking in a belt line. Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent. DescribePack: There were 2 bottles of air-temp detergent. One had a loose cap and spilled onto the box. This was due to inadequate packaging, blocking, and bracing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent.

item.title: Report X-2022100677
item.description:
Report X-2022100677

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-23
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During transference of HAZMAT package from belt to van, said package was mishandled and dropped onto the floor of the van, ultimately resulting in the loosening of the seals of the contents within. This resulted in the spill. Employees put on proper PPE and and placed package in a lined HAZMAT bin, and placed said bin within our HAZMAT Cage. DescribePack: Loose caps due to improper bracing and packing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE, and placed package within HAZMAT-bag lined bin, and then proceeded to place said bin within the HAZMAT Cage.

item.title: Report I-2022120116
item.description:
Report I-2022120116

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-27
  • City: Lewiston
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON 8/27/2022 AT APPROXIMATELY 1000, DANGEROUS GOODS ADMINISTRATION RECEIVED A CALL FROM EMPLOYEE 5080600, REPORTING AN UNDECLARED SPILL. THE SHIPMENT CONSISTED OF ONE FIBERBORARD BOX WITH 4 CANS OF WHAT APPEARS TO BE PAINT. THE ENCLOSED SDS MENTIONS UN 1866 RESIN SOLUTION. THE PAINT-LIKE SUBSTANCE APPEARED TO PHYSICALLY LEAK; HOWEVER, THE REPORTING AGENT INDICATED A STRONG URETHANE ODOR. ONE OF THE EMPLOYEE REPORTEDLY SUFFERED DISCOMFORT FROM HANDLING THE SHIPMENT AND WENT TO THE HOSPITAL, AND RECEIVED TREATMENT FOR A MINOR SKIN IRRITATION. THE SHIPMENT IS BEING HELD FOR AN FAA INVESTIGATION.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered to have a strong odor and a wet spot on the box during sort operations. Inner contents: Fuel injection pump for a tractor with residue of diesel fuel. The shipper confirmed that diesel fuel was in the pump. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 7659F0, THE UPS STORE, 1775 W STATE ST., BOISE ID 83702.

item.title: Report I-2022110254
item.description:
Report I-2022110254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-20
  • City: Twin Falls
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package arrived to station in Twin Falls Idaho. Upon arrival, shipper was recognized as having shipped undeclared ammunition in the past. Package was offered to management, who opened the package to inspect the contents. Inside the package (1 Large FedEx box) 20 boxes if rifles rounds were found. 10 boxes of 6.5prc, 10 boxes of 300prc. Package has been held pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2022080444
item.description:
Report X-2022080444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-08
  • City: POCATELLO
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pckg was loaded and back of trailer placed on its side with direction not point up. Had pckgs loaded on top of it. Discovered at point of unload at delivery station. QA took hazmat pckg and placed into bucket and was taken to QA cage for further processing. DescribePack: Pckg was loaded incorrectly causing closure to become loose and fluid to leak out of the top of inner container into outer packaging. Outer packaging had a small tear from leaking liquid. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Pckg was taken off the trailer as soon as PHs noticed it was leaking. QA put pckg in a plastic bin to ensure hazmat liquid was contained.

item.title: Report X-2022080424
item.description:
Report X-2022080424

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-12
  • City: POCATELLO
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handlers during unload of trailer saw hazmat pckg was leaking because of wet box. Package handlers notified QA so hazmat spill could be dealt with properly. QA recovered pckg in appropriate PPE and removed hazmat pckg to QA cage for proper analyzing and reporting. DescribePack: Lid closure became loosened allowing hazmat liquid to spill outside of pckg. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA place hazmat into bucket to ensure hazmat liquid was contained. QA was notified immediately upon recognizing hazmat leak.

  • City: MERIDIAN

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALLED FOR A SPILL IN A TRAILER THAT WAS ON DOOR 2. RESPONDED AND PROCEDED THROUGH THE DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP FOR CORROSIVE LIQUIDS WHICH WAS IDENTIFIED BY THE MARKINGS ON THE BOX AND UPS SHIPPING PAPERS. AFTER CLEANING UP THE AREA MOVED THE DAMGAED ITEAMS TO THE DMP STATION. FOLLOWED THE DECISON TREE FOR PROPER DMN PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report E-2022070924
item.description:
Report E-2022070924

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-11T21:08:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-24
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SPEED FREIGHT, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Speed Freight notified ERTS of a cargo release at 23801 S Orchard Access Rd, Boise, ID. It was originally reported that approximately 20 gallons of Sodium Chlorite Solution had been released from a 330-gallon poly tote due to damage during transit. The trailer seal has not been broken, so the amount of damaged totes is unknown. The release impacted a dirt parking lot and the inside of trailer #225723. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched an environmental contractor who arrived on site and estimated that approximately 125 gallons released to the trailer floor and adjacent asphalt parking lot. First responders had placed containment to secure the release. The contractor offloaded the leaking IBC and transferred the remaining product into a field supplied IBC. The contractor also conducted addiitonal product transferred from several damaged (but not leaking) IBCs. The contractor crew utilized additional absorbents and a power washer unit to clean the impacted areas. All waste was collected, containerized and staged on site pending waste profiling and final disposal operations.
